Warning: pre-emptive knee jerk rant
I don't get how Wizards can't make a non-boring Boros-ish commander in commander products
The best generals for those colors that they've made in a long time have all come from standard or conspiracy
It blows my mind
Brion Stoutarm is still the most innovative boros commander and he's from all the way back in Lorwyn
Depala, Alesha are also incredible
(Depala needs support, but her design is great)

White likes to make rules and red likes to punish things. White likes to reanimate small or specific things and red likes to make token copies of things. Both colors like artifacts. I don't know how it isn't obvious to them some of the other directions they could take it.
Even MaRo's comment on Blogatog the other day was "yeah, Boros is still just going to get more of the same. Enjoy."
"Okay for folks, let's make some rad Mardu vampires." "We could do that, but remember that Boros is part of Mardu." "Oh shit, right. Well what if Karador but terrible?" "Print it."
Hahahahaha
That's perfect.
The only thing I got is if you have a way to generate colored mana easily she/he goes infinite kinda easily with [[Warstorm Surge]]

attachments.text:
Enchantment

_"Listen to the roar! Feel the thunder! The Immersturm shouts its approval with every bolt of lightning!"_

So, Commander Vs. has a second preview card, but can't find an image. Mathas, Fiend Seeker. 3/3 for Mardu, with Menace, at your end step, put a bounty counter on target creature an opponent controls. So long as that creature has that counter on it, it has "When this creature dies, each opponent draws a card and gains 2 life."
There it is!

I'm confused, what did I miss

I'm glad that's going to be used as a diss now
I guess he's the curse guy maybe. Seems so half-assed though.
Who, Mathas?
Yeah
The bounty hunter? Why do you think he's half-assed?
Seems great to me.
Are half-asses tighter than whole asses?
Depends.
I guess he discourages saccing maybe? Is that something you want as a general?
To discourage one creature a turn from being killed?
No, you encourage others to target that creature for value.
Me drawing one card and my enemies drawing 2 isn't value
I mean, I guess they spent a removal spell/resources
Wait what do you mean? When the creature dies each opponent draws a card and gains two life. You target an opponent's creature.
I'm sure it'll be effective against bad players who make bad decisions with the badly constructed decks, but I'm not sure I need to build a deck around dealing with that particular pod
But it's each opponent. I don't want my opponents drawing stuff.
The draw is for the opponents of that creatures controller.
In a four man pod I get one, two people get one, the guy with the creature gets none
Sure, but they're taking out problems for you.
If they're dumb, sure
But like I said, I don't need a deck built around exploiting dumb people making dumb decisions
So they're dumb for targeting a creature that gives them value?
It doesn't give them value. Getting 1 card while your opponents get 2 isn't value
It's like howling mine. you get one, your opponents get three (in a four man pod). That isn't value
You're opponents each get 1 card. You make it sound like they each draw two.
They're all one big bad guy I hate and want to see die
They as an entitity get 2 cards, and I get one, and that's not great math
I don't see it that way.
That view disregards table politics.
or maybe it's assuming people have a better undertsanding of them than they really do
Mairsil the Pretender. One of the alternate commanders for Wizards
Undead Johnny Appleseed?
I see this and immediately I think of Harry Potter. "Wand of Yew, thirteen and a half inches, unicorn tail core. Nice and swishy. Good want for Charms work."
Have we ever seen a wizard with a wand before? I feel like that's a rare thing

Another problem with Mathas is a ton of removal in EDH isn't kill. Swords and Path are the top two tainstant removal spells in the format, and Chaos Warp, Utter End and Anguished Unmaking are in the top 10. It doesn't do anything with enchantment removal either.
Well it is on target creature but you can but sure there are more destroy than exile effects.
for sur
But there's plenty that arent, plus Rift, Merciless Eviction, etc.
Sure...but that doesn't invalidate the incentive.
Just seems like a bad idea to build a deck around hoping people use non bounce/exile/lock removal on other creatures
So Skullclamp is a bad idea because of all this exile?

Assuming you see it as an incentive. I wouldn't. Quite the opposite. I always kill the hug deck first unless there's a more imminent threat, and i'd absolutely gun for the Mathas deck for the same reason.
Skullclamp you control, and is almost always used on tokens or stuff you plan to sacc to an outlet. Radically different things.
Death triggers in general, then. You control the target.

I absolutely should NOT assume everyone thinks like me, but if a creature needs to be removed, I'm removing it. A bounty counter isn't going to make me kill one I wouldn't otherwise kill. Quite the opposite actually. I'd second guess removing a target with a bounty counter on it just because I only get one card and my opponents get two. It would be a disincentive for me to kill a creature probably more than the opposite.
Like I said though, I shouldn't assume that's the prevailing mindset
Even if it is mine
Not if it's on a high-value target that you were going to kill anyhow. Regardless  I see what you mean but I don't share that analysis.

If it's on a high value target I was going to kill anyhow all it's succeeded in doing is annoying me that the Mathas player is helping my enemies, and it makes me want him out of the game so he stops doing that.
Not everyone is me though :slightly_smiling_face:
Your annoyance can be useful too.
:smiling_imp:
True enough.
It's also why I'm not wild about the new curses

At least that effect is purely symmetrical though, so the argument can be made that if the attacker fancies himself a superior player he can better use the resources gained than the other person. It's harder to argue that when two people are getting the resources off Matthas.

There's an inverse way to look at it too. Cards like Mathas and Fractured Identity help multiple opponents, but there's something to be said for how much they *punish* the one opponent that gets left out. Everyone but you, draw a card. Every time that happens, they fall farther behind. It's like they started with 6 cards instead of 7. Over time, an effect like that can really take someone out of the running. I find that interesting design.
It's interesting, but it feels short sighted. When that person is dead, you still have to deal with the other two, and they're that much stronger.
Certainly sometimes you all need the extra gas to deal with the one person who pulled ahead bigly
You target the guy who played sol Ring turn one. They were obviously going to win anyhow.
It's a flavorful way for mardu to draw cards, if nothing else, and that's pretty neat
Another way to look at is to help guide newer players in their targeting. :innocent:
I assume Teferi's Protection would go in No-Turns decks. Right?
Maybe not
Did we already mention that, because I guess it could be horrible.
I mean... Protection from everything and no life change it good
At that point in time you are almost literally not in the game until your no turns runs out, lol
